message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.AI 

The paper proposes a neural network-based model for embedding two-dimensional locations in a continuous vector space, which is relevant to natural language processing and machine learning. Specifically, the model is evaluated over Twitter data for geolocation and lexical dialectology tasks, which are subfields of computational linguistics (cs.CL) and machine learning (cs.LG). The model also incorporates mixtures of Gaussian distributions, which is a common technique in statistical inference and probabilistic modeling, relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents a novel approach that outperforms conventional regression-based geolocation and provides a better estimate of uncertainty, which is of interest to researchers in social media analysis and data mining, relevant to social and information sciences (cs.SI).
